newsitem.title: USA: Jacor to swap TV station for radio stations.
newsitem.headline: Jacor to swap TV station for radio stations.

text.p: Jacor Communications Inc said Thursday it has reached an agreement with Gannett Co Inc to exchange Jacor's WTSP-TV station in Tampa, Fla., for six of Gannett's radio stations.

If approved by regulators, Jacor will assume ownership of Gannett's KIIS-FM and KIIS-AM radio stations in Los Angeles, KSDO-AM and KKBH-FM in San Diego, and WUSA-FM and WDAE-AM in Tampa-St. Petersburg.
Jacor owns, operates, represents or provides programming for 73 radio stations in the United States. It also owns WKRC-TV in Cincinnati.
The company said it plans to pursue further acquisitions of "complementary" stations in its existing markets, and radio groups or individual stations in other markets.
